text:
Sonia looked at the money on the table but quickly turned her gaze to Pyotr Petrovitch. She felt it was very rude to look at someone else's money. She noticed the gold eyeglass in his left hand and the big, beautiful ring with a yellow stone on his middle finger. Suddenly, she looked away and ended up staring straight at Pyotr Petrovitch again. After a moment of silence, he continued speaking with great seriousness.

"I happened to talk to Katerina Ivanovna yesterday, the poor woman. That was enough for me to see that she is in a very strange situation."

"Yes... strange..." Sonia quickly agreed.

"Or it would be easier to just say she is sick."

"Yes, easier and... yes, sick."

"Exactly. So, out of kindness and compassion, I want to help her because I see how unfortunate her situation is. I believe this whole poor family now depends completely on you?"

"May I ask," Sonia stood up, "did you tell her yesterday about the chance of a pension? Because she said you were going to help her get one. Is that true?"

"Not at all, and that’s ridiculous! I only suggested she might get some temporary help as the widow of an official who died while serving—if she has..."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sonia feels embarrassed while discussing Katerina Ivanovna's dire situation and the possibility of assistance with Pyotr Petrovitch.
